Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior, which is now very worn, is partially covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of one line of red-painted text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394369) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394369)
